comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: One Princess De Croy is Marie, but the photo at archive.org/stream/warmemories00croyuoft#page/74/mode/2up doesn't look to be an obvious match. But since she was imprisoned by the Germans durng WWI, she might have lost a lot of weight. Another picture of Princess Marie is at www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/portrait/mw224514/Princ... I'm inclined to think this picture is not of her.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Another Princess of Croy is Isabella en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Isabella_of_Cro%C3%BF This picture is a better match, but it seems less likely that she was in the news at this time. And fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isabelle_de_Cro%C3%BF suggests she would have been known as Archduchess given she was married to Archduke Frederick of Austria.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Yet another possibility is Princess Charles/Karl de Croy. She was Mathilde de Robiano, but would have been Princess De Croy after her marriage (confirmed by the 1946 announcement of her death at cartes-postales.delcampe.net/page/item/id,0199496393,lang...) I have now found www.genroy.fr/croy.htm which suggests there would have been a lot of women at this time who would be Princess De Croy in their own right and a bunch more who were married to a Prince De Croy.
